squats_feedback.right: Emphasis on the natural function and design of the squat position, suggesting a holistic approach.
squats_feedback.wrong: Misconception that squat is just an up-and-down exercise: Limits the understanding of the squat's full range of benefits and proper technique.
squats_feedback.correction: Focus on the squat as a functional movement that involves more than just moving up and down. Think about engaging multiple muscle groups and maintaining proper form throughout.

squats_feedback.right: Understanding that regaining the proper squat position is important.
squats_feedback.wrong: Sitting up on toes: This indicates a lack of ankle mobility and improper weight distribution.
squats_feedback.correction: Use aids like yoga blocks or books to help achieve proper form. Gradually work your way down to squatting flat on the floor to improve ankle mobility and balance.

squats_feedback.right: Recommending daily practice to regain squat ability, emphasizing consistency.
squats_feedback.wrong: Assuming everyone can easily regain natural squat posture without aids.
squats_feedback.correction: Encourage the use of aids like yoga blocks or books to assist in regaining proper form and gradually transition to squatting without them.
